content:
Limit Who Receives Notifications About Certificate Expiration

By popular demand, you now have more control over who gets certificate expiration email notifications. Assign the new Receive Certificate Expiration Notifications user permission to the admins who manage certificates. Also, notification emails now include more details about how to update certificates before they expire.

Where: This change applies to Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: When you assign the new system permission to at least one admin, all other admins see fewer certificate-related emails in their inboxes. And admins that you designate to receive expiration notifications are better informed about how to handle impending certificate expirations.

How: In Setup, add the Receive Certificate Expiration Notifications to a new permission set. Then assign that permission set to a user. Users with the permission receive emails at 60, 30, and 10 days before a certificate expires. To prevent service interruptions caused by expired certificates, we still send email notifications to all admins the day before and the day of a certificate's expiration.

If you don't assign this permission to anyone, all admins continue to receive all certificate expiration emails.
title: Certificate Expiration Notifications Control
